text: ੴ ਸਤਿਨਾਮੁ ਕਰਤਾ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਨਿਰਭਉ ਨਿਰਵੈਰੁ ਅਕਾਲ ਮੂਰਤਿ ਅਜੂਨੀ ਸੈਭੰ ਗੁਰ ਪ੍ਰਸਾਦਿ ॥

translation.text: One Universal Creator God. Truth Is The Name. Creative Being Personified. No Fear. No Hatred. Image Of The Undying. Beyond Birth. Self-Existent. By Guru's Grace:

transliteration.text: ik ōunkār satinām karatā purakh nirabhau niravair akāl mūrat ajūnī saibhan gur prasād .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਰਾਗੁ ਪਰਭਾਤੀ ਬਿਭਾਸ ਮਹਲਾ ੧ ਚਉਪਦੇ ਘਰੁ ੧ ॥

translation.text: Raag Parbhaatee Bibhaas, First Mehl, Chau-Padas, First House:

transliteration.text: rāg parabhātī bibhās mahalā 1 chaupadē ghar 1 .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਨਾਇ ਤੇਰੈ ਤਰਣਾ ਨਾਇ ਪਤਿ ਪੂਜ ॥

translation.text: Your Name carries us across; Your Name brings respect and worship.

transliteration.text: nāi tērai taranā nāi pat pūj .

melody.description: Parbhati Bibhas expresses the feelings of compromise between the mind and the soul; a common understanding between the selfishness of the mind and the devotion of the soul evolves. The atmosphere created is like the calmness and serenity of daybreak, along with a sense of preparation for the day to unfold. The ‘partaal’ rhythm represents the change in the method, which is induced by compromise, however it also highlights the balance of concentration.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਨਾਉ ਤੇਰਾ ਗਹਣਾ ਮਤਿ ਮਕਸੂਦੁ ॥

translation.text: Your Name embellishes us; it is the object of the awakened mind.

transliteration.text: nāu tērā gahanā mat makasūd .

melody.description: Parbhati Bibhas expresses the feelings of compromise between the mind and the soul; a common understanding between the selfishness of the mind and the devotion of the soul evolves. The atmosphere created is like the calmness and serenity of daybreak, along with a sense of preparation for the day to unfold. The ‘partaal’ rhythm represents the change in the method, which is induced by compromise, however it also highlights the balance of concentration.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:

text: ਨਾਇ ਤੇਰੈ ਨਾਉ ਮੰਨੇ ਸਭ ਕੋਇ ॥

translation.text: Your Name brings honor to everyone's name.

transliteration.text: nāi tērai nāu mannē sabh kōi .

melody.description: Parbhati Bibhas expresses the feelings of compromise between the mind and the soul; a common understanding between the selfishness of the mind and the devotion of the soul evolves. The atmosphere created is like the calmness and serenity of daybreak, along with a sense of preparation for the day to unfold. The ‘partaal’ rhythm represents the change in the method, which is induced by compromise, however it also highlights the balance of concentration.

text: ਵਿਣੁ ਨਾਵੈ ਪਤਿ ਕਬਹੁ ਨ ਹੋਇ ॥੧॥

translation.text: Without Your Name, no one is ever respected. ||1||

transliteration.text: vin nāvai pat kabah n hōi .1.

melody.description: Parbhati Bibhas expresses the feelings of compromise between the mind and the soul; a common understanding between the selfishness of the mind and the devotion of the soul evolves. text: ਅਵਰ ਸਿਆਣਪ ਸਗਲੀ ਪਾਜੁ ॥

translation.text: All other clever tricks are just for show.

transliteration.text: avar siānap sagalī pāj .

melody.description: Parbhati Bibhas expresses the feelings of compromise between the mind and the soul; a common understanding between the selfishness of the mind and the devotion of the soul evolves. The atmosphere created is like the calmness and serenity of daybreak, along with a sense of preparation for the day to unfold. text: ਜੈ ਬਖਸੇ ਤੈ ਪੂਰਾ ਕਾਜੁ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥

translation.text: Whoever the Lord blesses with forgiveness - his affairs are perfectly resolved. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: jai bakhasē tai pūrā kāj .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Parbhati Bibhas expresses the feelings of compromise between the mind and the soul; a common understanding between the selfishness of the mind and the devotion of the soul evolves. text: ਨਾਉ ਤੇਰਾ ਤਾਣੁ ਨਾਉ ਦੀਬਾਣੁ ॥

translation.text: Your Name is my strength; Your Name is my support.

transliteration.text: nāu tērā tān nāu dībān .

melody.description: Parbhati Bibhas expresses the feelings of compromise between the mind and the soul; a common understanding between the selfishness of the mind and the devotion of the soul evolves. text: ਨਾਉ ਤੇਰਾ ਲਸਕਰੁ ਨਾਉ ਸੁਲਤਾਨੁ ॥

translation.text: Your Name is my army; Your Name is my king.

transliteration.text: nāu tērā lasakar nāu sulatān .

melody.description: Parbhati Bibhas expresses the feelings of compromise between the mind and the soul; a common understanding between the selfishness of the mind and the devotion of the soul evolves. text: ਨਾਇ ਤੇਰੈ ਮਾਣੁ ਮਹਤ ਪਰਵਾਣੁ ॥

translation.text: Your Name brings honor, glory and approval.

transliteration.text: nāi tērai mān mahat paravān .

melody.description: Parbhati Bibhas expresses the feelings of compromise between the mind and the soul; a common understanding between the selfishness of the mind and the devotion of the soul evolves. text: ਤੇਰੀ ਨਦਰੀ ਕਰਮਿ ਪਵੈ ਨੀਸਾਣੁ ॥੨॥

translation.text: By Your Grace, one is blessed with the banner and the insignia of Your Mercy. ||2||

transliteration.text: tērī nadarī karam pavai nīsān .2.

text: ਨਾਇ ਤੇਰੈ ਸਹਜੁ ਨਾਇ ਸਾਲਾਹ ॥

translation.text: Your Name brings intuitive peace and poise; Your Name brings praise.

transliteration.text: nāi tērai sahaj nāi sālāh .

text: ਨਾਉ ਤੇਰਾ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤੁ ਬਿਖੁ ਉਠਿ ਜਾਇ ॥

translation.text: Your Name is the Ambrosial Nectar which cleans out the poison.

transliteration.text: nāu tērā anmrit bikh uth jāi .

text: ਨਾਇ ਤੇਰੈ ਸਭਿ ਸੁਖ ਵਸਹਿ ਮਨਿ ਆਇ ॥

translation.text: Through Your Name, all peace and comfort comes to abide in the mind.

transliteration.text: nāi tērai sabh sukh vasah man āi .

text: ਬਿਨੁ ਨਾਵੈ ਬਾਧੀ ਜਮ ਪੁਰਿ ਜਾਇ ॥੩॥

translation.text: Without the Name, they are bound and gagged, and dragged off to the City of Death. ||3||

transliteration.text: bin nāvai bādhī jam pur jāi .3.

text: ਨਾਰੀ ਬੇਰੀ ਘਰ ਦਰ ਦੇਸ ॥

translation.text: Man is involved with his wife, hearth and home, land and country,

transliteration.text: nārī bērī ghar dar dēs .

text: ਮਨ ਕੀਆ ਖੁਸੀਆ ਕੀਚਹਿ ਵੇਸ ॥

translation.text: the pleasures of the mind and fine clothes;

transliteration.text: man kīā khusīā kīchah vēs .

text: ਜਾਂ ਸਦੇ ਤਾਂ ਢਿਲ ਨ ਪਾਇ ॥

translation.text: but when the call comes, he cannot delay.

transliteration.text: jānh sadē tānh dhil n pāi .

text: ਨਾਨਕ ਕੂੜੁ ਕੂੜੋ ਹੋਇ ਜਾਇ ॥੪॥੧॥

translation.text: O Nanak, in the end, the false turn out to be false. ||4||1||

transliteration.text: nānak kūr kūrō hōi jāi .4.1.
